newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan says no requests yet to cut sugar tariffs.
newsitem.headline: Japan says no requests yet to cut sugar tariffs.

text.p: Japan's Agriculture Ministry said on Wednesday that it had not received any requests from the Thai or Australian sugar industries to reduce its import tariffs.

On Monday, the secretary-general of the Thai Cane and Sugar Board, Pramote Vidtayasuk, said the board and the Queensland Sugar Corp were set to cooperate on seeking tariff cuts on sugar exports to Japan and South Korea.
"We've received no request to reduce sugar tariffs from Thailand and Australia so far," a ministry official said.
Japan currently imposes import tariffs of up to 50 yen per kg of raw sugar. It also imposes up to 87 yen in tariffs on white sugar imports.
Local industry officials say reducing the tariffs would be politically sensitive for the Japanese government, as part of the revenue is used to support domestic sugar producers.
